FuncDef:
The ipv6 direct-routing-table local-host-route advertise enable command enables a directly connected interface to advertise IPv6 host routes.
The undo ipv6 direct-routing-table local-host-route advertise enable command disables a directly connected interface from advertising IPv6 host routes. The ipv6 direct-routing-table local-host-route advertise enable command enables a directly connected interface to advertise IPv6 host routes. The undo ipv6 direct-routing-table local-host-route advertise enable command disables a directly connected interface from advertising IPv6 host routes. By default, IPv6 host routes of directly connected interfaces are not advertised. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: undo ipv6 direct-routing-table local-host-route advertise enable
ExtraInfo: By default, after a routing protocol imports an IPv6 host route from a directly connected interface, the routing protocol only stores the route in the routing table and does not advertise the route. If IPv6 host routes need to be advertised, run the ipv6 direct-routing-table local-host-route advertise enable command to enable the IPv6 host route advertisement function on the directly connected interface.
